briefTitle: Gabapentin in the Prevention of Nausea and Vomiting Induced by Chemotherapy

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* First course of chemotherapy ( cisplatin or doxorubicin at a dose of at least 50mg per square meter)
* Written informed consent must be obtained before initiating the protocol procedures

Exclusion Criteria:

* ECOG 3
* Nausea and vomiting within the past 1 day
* Gastrointestinal obstruction
* Concurrent use of opioid
* Patients with brain metastases
* History of allergic or other adverse reaction to gabapentin

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients With Complete Response During Chemotherapy Course 1
outcomeMeasures.description: The CR was defined as no emetic episodes and no nausea episodes from day 1 to day 5 (0-120h)

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients With CR During Delayed-onset Phase (24-120 Hours) After Administration of Chemotherapy Course 1
outcomeMeasures.description: Complete response during delayed-onset phase was defined as the absence of any episode of nausea or vomiting and no use of rescue medication when occurring during the period from days 2 through 5 after chemotherapy
